title.narrative: Guinea-Bissau: Targeted country assistance
Guinée-Bissau (la): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Financing/Sustainability
1. The annual sustainability plan available. 2. Quarterly report on joint follow up of implementation of advocacy plan available

target.value: International technical to support MoH and MoF on develompment and implementation of Advocacy and financial sustainability plan that include participation of other stakeholders

comment.narrative: A draft advocacy and financial sustainability plan was drown up las year, but due to global containment, it was undertaken recently but not yet finalized.

title.narrative: The situation analysis and all related documts gathered for the development of the NIS plan, and the annual ction plan and regional micoplans developed and validated

target.value: Support the country to developp and implement the National Immunization Strategy (NIS) and annual action plan at central level and micro plan at Regional and District levels

comment.narrative: All tools and documents for the assessment of the implementation of the current cMYP (2018 - 2022) were gathered, but due the Covid-19 vaccination challenges, this activity couldn`t be implemented. On the other hand, the annual action plan at the central level was developed, and the tools for the development of micro plans at regional level were developed.

title.narrative: Quarterly advocacy and financial report available

target.value: International technical to support MoH and MoF on develompment and implementation of Advocacy and financial sustainability plan that include participation of other stakeholders

comment.narrative: The international technical support to MoH an MoF is again ongoing currently, therefore the financial report is not yet available.

target.value: International technical to support MoH and MoF on develompment and implementation of Advocacy and financial sustainability plan that include participation of other stakeholders

comment.narrative: The international technical support to MoH an MoF is again ongoing currently, therefore the financial report is not yet available.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Information Systems (Data)
Report of trained staff on data quality check and validation available

target.value: Technical support of an Immunization Officer to national EPI team for improvement of routine immunization/SIAs data collection tools, data quality improvement and analysis for decision making as well as capacity reinforcement

comment.narrative: Due to the shortage of qualified staff, UNICEF Guinea-Bissau had a hard time finding a fit for the post technician, something that was only possible at the end of May. However, two technicians were recruited who are placed with the health authorities, each occupying two regions to support the region in improving the quality of routine vaccination data, support in routine vaccination activities and equity (fixed strategies, advanced and mobile), formative supervision and surveillance of EPI target diseases, and in the collection and analysis of data from the vaccination campaign against COVID-19. Training is scheduled to begin at the end of July in the regions of Oio, Cacheu, Bafata and Gabu.

target.value: Technical support of an Immunization Officer to national EPI team for improvement of routine immunization/SIAs data collection tools, data quality improvement and analysis for decision making as well as capacity reinforcement

comment.narrative: Due to the shortage of qualified staff, UNICEF Guinea-Bissau had a hard time finding a fit for the post technician, something that was only possible at the end of May. However, two technicians were recruited who are placed with the health authorities, each occupying two regions to support the region in improving the quality of routine vaccination data, support in routine vaccination activities and equity (fixed strategies, advanced and mobile), formative supervision and surveillance of EPI target diseases, and in the collection and analysis of data from the vaccination campaign against COVID-19. Training is scheduled to begin at the end of July in the regions of Oio, Cacheu, Bafata and Gabu.

target.value: Technical support of an Immunization Officer to national EPI team for improvement of routine immunization/SIAs data collection tools, data quality improvement and analysis for decision making as well as capacity reinforcement

comment.narrative: The shortage of human resources in the national market, caused a delay in filling this post. The solution found was to hire two consultants to be based in the 4 districts (2 districts each) with low coverage and to be able to support those EPI manager in the districts in the implementation of vaccination activities. However, with the strike in the public service that started from December 2020 to the present date, it was impossible to have counterparts with whom to work in the field, but in what was possible they worked diligently to in the support to the district managers, as the attached monthly report shows.

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
The proposal for the new vaccine (HPV,) introduction developed and submitted

target.value: Technical support for the introduction of the new vaccines (HPV, etc), and monitoring of AEFI during and after the introduction.

comment.narrative: Given the negative impact of the 3rd Covid-19 wave with peak in August, the country missed the September window for submitting the proposals. Therefore it`s planned for May 2022.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
1. All data managers at central as well as at regional levels are trainned on DHIS2 2. Quality data on vaccination indicators shared on a quarterly basis

target.value: Technical assistance to support training on DHIS2 platform, monitoring and evaluation of the data quality improvement plan

comment.narrative: Last year, the hiring process had been lunched, and a candidate was found, but due Covid-19 pandemic, all the procedures were canceled, and so far it has not been possible to find Portuguese speaking candidates.

title.narrative: Report on EPI target population available by age group and gender

target.value: Technical support for coordination of census of EPI target population by using Community Health Worker (CHW)

comment.narrative: One national consultant had been identified and due to Covid-19 all the process was cancelled, and so far it has not yet been conducted.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Technical support from one local NGO for implementation of urban strategy in SAB, Bafata and Gabu ? Train activists in the methodology of identifying and registering households with children at vaccine age ? Census of family members with children at vaccine age and follow-up ? Adoption of necessary materials and equipment and production of management tools ? Community mobilization and engagement ? Coordination and management of activities delineated in the Urban Strategy

comment.narrative: Preliminary contacts were made with the NGOs in order to assess their capacities to implement the immunization strategy in the urban environment, which was developed with the support of GAVI. The national Red Cross was selected and the process to establish a Memorandum of Understanding began, which should be ready by the beginning of January 2022.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Systems in place to track vaccine stocks at all levels and corrective measures undertaken

target.value: Technical assistant for strengthening of the effective vaccine management at all level.

comment.narrative: The country hired a Cold Chain and Logistic specialist, who support the country on implementation of EVM improvement plan and also COVID-19 campaign logistics . Quarterly updated CCE inventory, reports on Temperature Monitoring, Rehabilitation/expansion and extension of CCE available to GAVI, UNICEF.

title.narrative: WHO : Data
The protocol of the vaccination coverage survey developed and aproved

target.value: Technical support to carry out the vaccination coverage survey

comment.narrative: The development of the protocol of the vaccination coverage survey was delayed due to Covid-19 vaccination challenges, but it`s already ongoing.

title.narrative: Data improvement field activity implemented (review, validation, monitoring, harmonisation, mentorship, workshop, others)

target.value: Technical assistance to support training on DHIS2 platform, monitoring and evaluation of the data quality improvement plan

comment.narrative: This activity has not been implemented because, it was planned for the TCA 2020, which was extended to end 2021, and just implemented in the Q4 2021. Hence, this activity was postponed to Q1 2022.

title.narrative: WHO
Immunization policy available

target.value: Support for the implementation of Addis declaration roadmap (immunization policy, low on vaccination and resource mobilization)

comment.narrative: The immunization policy is now available, and the Portuguese version is going to be validated at the ICC meeting to be hold on the 2nd of July.

title.narrative: Legislation on vacciantion procedures approved by the national parliament

target.value: Support for the implementation of Addis declaration roadmap (immunization policy, low on vaccination and resource mobilization)

comment.narrative: The low on vaccination was created and the Portuguese version is going to be technically validated at the ICC meeting to be hold on the 2nd of July. Afterwards, it will be submitted to the national parliament for approval. The delay was due to the global containment, because the hiring process of one international consultant began last year before Covid-19 hit the country, but after the 1st case was diagnosed, all the hiring procedures were cancelled.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Data
Data Improvement Plan (DIP) developed

target.value: Technical support of an Immunization Officer to national EPI team for improvement of routine immunization/SIAs data quality improvement and analysis for decision making as well as capacity reinforcement

comment.narrative: The process of recruitment of expert on Data Management is ongoing although the shortage of available candidate is the main bottleneck. However, we expect to hire someone soon so he/she can start in second half of December.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Report on effective implementation of the urban vaccination strategy available

target.value: Technical support for follow up the implementation of urban vaccination strategy in Bissau and capital city of the regions (Canchungo, Gabu and Bafata)

comment.narrative: This activity has not been implemented, because since las year, due to global containment, others vaccination strategies than fixed at the health facilities have not been implemented, and since November 2020, strake is ongoing in the country including health sector.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Report on staff training and quarterly report on RED/REC implementation plan

target.value: Support the implementation of RED/REC approach: Development of RED/REC implementation plan, training of operational staff, quarterly workshop for learnt lessons' sharing,

comment.narrative: The delay on this activities is caused by delay on training the trainers on RED?REC approached with is in charge of WHO. However, WHO managed to train the trainers last week, and the process of training front line staff is ongoing.

target.value: Support the implementation of RED/REC approach: Development of RED/REC implementation plan, training of operational staff, quarterly workshop for learnt lessons' sharing,

comment.narrative: This activity was planned to train technicians in the regions on RED/REC approach, however the regional health directors who were trained as trainers have all been replaced by the new directors and they (the trainers) have found other jobs and are not available to provide this training. Therefore, the country is trying to mobilize funds to train new trainers and thus proceed with the training of technicians in the regions.

target.value: Support the implementation of RED/REC approach: Development of RED/REC implementation plan, training of operational staff, quarterly workshop for learnt lessons' sharing,

comment.narrative: This activity was planned to train technicians in the regions on RED/REC approach, however the regional health directors who were trained as trainers have all been replaced by the new directors and they (the trainers) have found other jobs and are not available to provide this training. Therefore, the country is trying to mobilize funds to train new trainers and thus proceed with the training of technicians in the regions.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Report of the training on C4D for immunization to national counterparts at central and local levels as well as to other partners involved in immunization programme available

target.value: National technical assistant to support increase demand of immunization by the population, to ensure the involvement of community and religious leaders in social mobilization and to follow and monitor the implementation of the Integrated Communication Plan; Prepare document on community engagement framework.

comment.narrative: Despite the efforts made, it was not possible to find candidate fit for the post. So, this post continue vacant.

target.value: National technical assistant to support increase demand of immunization by the population, to ensure the involvement of community and religious leaders in social mobilization and to follow and monitor the implementation of the Integrated Communication Plan; Prepare document on community engagement framework.

comment.narrative: This post has already been launched several times, but the country continues to face a lack of suitable candidates for this post. At this time, the process was restarted again, there were 3 pre-selected and the interview is scheduled for 06/28/2021 at 4 pm.

target.value: National technical assistant to support increase demand of immunization by the population, to ensure the involvement of community and religious leaders in social mobilization and to follow and monitor the implementation of the Integrated Communication Plan; Prepare document on community engagement framework.

comment.narrative: This post has already been launched several times, but the country continues to face a lack of suitable candidates for this post. At this time, the process was restarted again, there were 3 pre-selected and the interview is scheduled for 06/28/2021 at 4 pm.

title.narrative: Solina Health : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)

The EPI management team is demonstrating sustained change in business as usual as demonstrated by metrics agreed upon in the initial institutional assessment (including vaccine availability, funds availability; workplan execution and ultimately increased vaccination coverage and reduced inequity)

target.value: 1-Strengthen the capacity of the EPI management team in the area of program
1-Strengthen the capacity of the EPI management team in the area of program

title.narrative: The EPI team is demonstrating sustained change in business as usual as demonstrated by improved management of the EPI program, strengthened coordination among stakeholders, improved EPI team productivity, and ultimately increased vaccination coverage and reduced inequity

target.value: 2-Reinforce the leadership of the EPI management team and provide them with the appropriate management approaches, techniques and tools
2-Reinforce the leadership of the EPI management team and provide them with the appropriate management approaches, techniques and tools

title.narrative: Evaluation findings of procedure implementation with recommendations for adjustments shared with the EPI Director and the Gavi Country team

target.value: 3-Support the organizational optimization of the EPI by reviewing the macro-processes and the procedures manual
3-Support the organizational optimization of the EPI by reviewing the macro-processes and the procedures manual

title.narrative: The EPI team is optimally staffed (all key roles at National level filled with competent staff) with demonstrable improvement in staff productivity as a result of a functional performance management system with clear accountabilities

target.value: 4-Develop an EPI human resources management in accordance with recognized standard and initiate performance-based management
4-Develop an EPI human resources management in accordance with recognized standard and initiate performance-based management

title.narrative: The ICC and EPI TWG functioning effectively based on Gavi's recommended standards for National Coordination Forums

target.value: Continue the work to strengthen the Interagency Coordination Committee (ICC) and governance structures
Continue the work to strengthen the Interagency Coordination Committee (ICC) and governance structures

Covid-19 digital package installed
